page.title: 13Horndon Methodist R.C Church
page.content: The first Methodist Chapel was built in the mill ground in 1885, but in 1890 the present Chapel was erected in the High Road. The Minister is Rev. Morrell. Next to the Chapel is a thatched cottage and then the Methodist Youth Hall. At the Feast and Fayre the Chapel has a Flower Festival showing a different theme each year. In the hall refreshments are provided and there is a display of art work by the children of the Village School. The Horndon Society recently built the car park wall for the hall. The Roman CAtholic Church is called Church of the Sacred Heart. It was built in 1938 in Oxford Road on part of the land called The Priory to replace a smaller building. A camp was run on the land earlier in the century for poor boys from Bermondsey.
